005package edu.wpi.first.math;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation3d;
009
010/** Math utility functions. */
011public final class MathUtil {
012  private MathUtil() {
013    throw new AssertionError("utility class");
014  }
015
016  /**
017   * Returns value clamped between low and high boundaries.
018   *
019   * @param value Value to clamp.
020   * @param low The lower boundary to which to clamp value.
021   * @param high The higher boundary to which to clamp value.
022   * @return The clamped value.
023   */
024  public static int clamp(int value, int low, int high) {
025    return Math.max(low, Math.min(value, high));
026  }
027
028  /**
029   * Returns value clamped between low and high boundaries.
030   *
031   * @param value Value to clamp.
032   * @param low The lower boundary to which to clamp value.
033   * @param high The higher boundary to which to clamp value.
034   * @return The clamped value.
035   */
036  public static double clamp(double value, double low, double high) {
037    return Math.max(low, Math.min(value, high));
038  }
039
040  /**
041   * Returns 0.0 if the given value is within the specified range around zero. The remaining range
042   * between the deadband and the maximum magnitude is scaled from 0.0 to the maximum magnitude.
043   *
044   * @param value Value to clip.
045   * @param deadband Range around zero.
046   * @param maxMagnitude The maximum magnitude of the input. Can be infinite.
047   * @return The value after the deadband is applied.
048   */
049  public static double applyDeadband(double value, double deadband, double maxMagnitude) {
050    if (Math.abs(value) < deadband) {
051      return 0;
052    }
053    if (value > 0.0) {
054      // Map deadband to 0 and map max to max with a linear relationship.
055      //
056      //   y - y₁ = m(x - x₁)
057      //   y - y₁ = (y₂ - y₁)/(x₂ - x₁) (x - x₁)
058      //   y = (y₂ - y₁)/(x₂ - x₁) (x - x₁) + y₁
059      //
060      // (x₁, y₁) = (deadband, 0) and (x₂, y₂) = (max, max).
061      //
062      //   x₁ = deadband
063      //   y₁ = 0
064      //   x₂ = max
065      //   y₂ = max
066      //   y = (max - 0)/(max - deadband) (x - deadband) + 0
067      //   y = max/(max - deadband) (x - deadband)
068      //
069      // To handle high values of max, rewrite so that max only appears on the denominator.
070      //
071      //   y = ((max - deadband) + deadband)/(max - deadband) (x - deadband)
072      //   y = (1 + deadband/(max - deadband)) (x - deadband)
073      return (1 + deadband / (maxMagnitude - deadband)) * (value - deadband);
074    } else {
075      // Map -deadband to 0 and map -max to -max with a linear relationship.
076      //
077      //   y - y₁ = m(x - x₁)
078      //   y - y₁ = (y₂ - y₁)/(x₂ - x₁) (x - x₁)
079      //   y = (y₂ - y₁)/(x₂ - x₁) (x - x₁) + y₁
080      //
081      // (x₁, y₁) = (-deadband, 0) and (x₂, y₂) = (-max, -max).
082      //
083      //   x₁ = -deadband
084      //   y₁ = 0
085      //   x₂ = -max
086      //   y₂ = -max
087      //   y = (-max - 0)/(-max + deadband) (x + deadband) + 0
088      //   y = max/(max - deadband) (x + deadband)
089      //
090      // To handle high values of max, rewrite so that max only appears on the denominator.
091      //
092      //   y = ((max - deadband) + deadband)/(max - deadband) (x + deadband)
093      //   y = (1 + deadband/(max - deadband)) (x + deadband)
094      return (1 + deadband / (maxMagnitude - deadband)) * (value + deadband);
095    }
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Returns 0.0 if the given value is within the specified range around zero. The remaining range
100   * between the deadband and 1.0 is scaled from 0.0 to 1.0.
101   *
102   * @param value Value to clip.
103   * @param deadband Range around zero.
104   * @return The value after the deadband is applied.
105   */
106  public static double applyDeadband(double value, double deadband) {
107    return applyDeadband(value, deadband, 1);
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Returns modulus of input.
112   *
113   * @param input Input value to wrap.
114   * @param minimumInput The minimum value expected from the input.
115   * @param maximumInput The maximum value expected from the input.
116   * @return The wrapped value.
117   */
118  public static double inputModulus(double input, double minimumInput, double maximumInput) {
119    double modulus = maximumInput - minimumInput;
120
121    // Wrap input if it's above the maximum input
122    int numMax = (int) ((input - minimumInput) / modulus);
123    input -= numMax * modulus;
124
125    // Wrap input if it's below the minimum input
126    int numMin = (int) ((input - maximumInput) / modulus);
127    input -= numMin * modulus;
128
129    return input;
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Wraps an angle to the range -π to π radians.
134   *
135   * @param angleRadians Angle to wrap in radians.
136   * @return The wrapped angle.
137   */
138  public static double angleModulus(double angleRadians) {
139    return inputModulus(angleRadians, -Math.PI, Math.PI);
140  }
141
142  /**
143   * Perform linear interpolation between two values.
144   *
145   * @param startValue The value to start at.
146   * @param endValue The value to end at.
147   * @param t How far between the two values to interpolate. This is clamped to [0, 1].
148   * @return The interpolated value.
149   */
150  public static double interpolate(double startValue, double endValue, double t) {
151    return startValue + (endValue - startValue) * MathUtil.clamp(t, 0, 1);
152  }
153
154  /**
155   * Return where within interpolation range [0, 1] q is between startValue and endValue.
156   *
157   * @param startValue Lower part of interpolation range.
158   * @param endValue Upper part of interpolation range.
159   * @param q Query.
160   * @return Interpolant in range [0, 1].
161   */
162  public static double inverseInterpolate(double startValue, double endValue, double q) {
163    double totalRange = endValue - startValue;
164    if (totalRange <= 0) {
165      return 0.0;
166    }
167    double queryToStart = q - startValue;
168    if (queryToStart <= 0) {
169      return 0.0;
170    }
171    return queryToStart / totalRange;
172  }
173
174  /**
175   * Checks if the given value matches an expected value within a certain tolerance.
176   *
177   * @param expected The expected value
178   * @param actual The actual value
179   * @param tolerance The allowed difference between the actual and the expected value
180   * @return Whether or not the actual value is within the allowed tolerance
181   */
182  public static boolean isNear(double expected, double actual, double tolerance) {
183    if (tolerance < 0) {
184      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Tolerance must be a non-negative number!");
185    }
186    return Math.abs(expected - actual) < tolerance;
187  }
188
189  /**
190   * Checks if the given value matches an expected value within a certain tolerance. Supports
191   * continuous input for cases like absolute encoders.
192   *
193   * <p>Continuous input means that the min and max value are considered to be the same point, and
194   * tolerances can be checked across them. A common example would be for absolute encoders: calling
195   * isNear(2, 359, 5, 0, 360) returns true because 359 is 1 away from 360 (which is treated as the
196   * same as 0) and 2 is 2 away from 0, adding up to an error of 3 degrees, which is within the
197   * given tolerance of 5.
198   *
199   * @param expected The expected value
200   * @param actual The actual value
201   * @param tolerance The allowed difference between the actual and the expected value
202   * @param min Smallest value before wrapping around to the largest value
203   * @param max Largest value before wrapping around to the smallest value
204   * @return Whether or not the actual value is within the allowed tolerance
205   */
206  public static boolean isNear(
207      double expected, double actual, double tolerance, double min, double max) {
208    if (tolerance < 0) {
209      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Tolerance must be a non-negative number!");
210    }
211    // Max error is exactly halfway between the min and max
212    double errorBound = (max - min) / 2.0;
213    double error = MathUtil.inputModulus(expected - actual, -errorBound, errorBound);
214    return Math.abs(error) < tolerance;
215  }
216
217  /**
218   * Limits translation velocity.
219   *
220   * @param current Translation at current timestep.
221   * @param next Translation at next timestep.
222   * @param dt Timestep duration.
223   * @param maxVelocity Maximum translation velocity.
224   * @return Returns the next Translation2d limited to maxVelocity
225   */
226  public static Translation2d slewRateLimit(
227      Translation2d current, Translation2d next, double dt, double maxVelocity) {
228    if (maxVelocity < 0) {
229      Exception e = new IllegalArgumentException();
230      MathSharedStore.reportError(
231          "maxVelocity must be a non-negative number, got " + maxVelocity, e.getStackTrace());
232      return next;
233    }
234    Translation2d diff = next.minus(current);
235    double dist = diff.getNorm();
236    if (dist < 1e-9) {
237      return next;
238    }
239    if (dist > maxVelocity * dt) {
240      // Move maximum allowed amount in direction of the difference
241      return current.plus(diff.times(maxVelocity * dt / dist));
242    }
243    return next;
244  }
245
246  /**
247   * Limits translation velocity.
248   *
249   * @param current Translation at current timestep.
250   * @param next Translation at next timestep.
251   * @param dt Timestep duration.
252   * @param maxVelocity Maximum translation velocity.
253   * @return Returns the next Translation3d limited to maxVelocity
254   */
255  public static Translation3d slewRateLimit(
256      Translation3d current, Translation3d next, double dt, double maxVelocity) {
257    if (maxVelocity < 0) {
258      Exception e = new IllegalArgumentException();
259      MathSharedStore.reportError(
260          "maxVelocity must be a non-negative number, got " + maxVelocity, e.getStackTrace());
261      return next;
262    }
263    Translation3d diff = next.minus(current);
264    double dist = diff.getNorm();
265    if (dist < 1e-9) {
266      return next;
267    }
268    if (dist > maxVelocity * dt) {
269      // Move maximum allowed amount in direction of the difference
270      return current.plus(diff.times(maxVelocity * dt / dist));
271    }
272    return next;
273  }
274}
